computer.description:
The PCS 80 came with a lot of peripherals: line and character printers, CRT terminals, intelligent keyboards, ACR storage, 8" and 5.25" floppy disks and with several languages: TTY BASIC with OS, 4K, 8K and 12K BASIC, audio cassette BASIC with OS, & a scientifically oriented disk BASIC and level 2 Fortran IV compiler.
Greg Bober stil have an extended working configuration including:  External 5.25" quad density 380Kb Micropolis floppy with BASIC,  Faster memory & "I" tempgrade CPU, speed could goto 7MHz,  58K 10MHz RAM,  Custom boot operating system,  64K of extended RAM/ported PROM containing the DOS & BASIC operating system to have 1 second versus 30 second floppy boot up,  Extrernal 12" monitor since 24x80 is hard to see on tiny screen,  Spare parts. Numerous photos of his system may be seen here.
computer.name: PCS 80
computer.peripherals: Floppy drives inteface, Single or dual 8'' drives in a separate housing same size as main frame unit
computer.ports: Serial ports (2) - Parallel Port (1) - Monitor - S100 Bus (8 expansion slots)
computer.ram: 2.25 KB (up to 64 KB thanks to RAM boards, there are 4K, 16K, 32K and 64K memory expansion boards).
computer.text: 12x40, 12x80, 24x40 and 24x80 (128 characters of either 5x7 or 7x10 dot matirx fonts)
